Event.0: New Zealand rugby union football player Jonah Lomu, who was perhaps rugby's first global icon, died of a heart attack at age 40 after a long battle with kidney disease.
Event.1: "The X Factor" group One Direction release their debut album "Up All Night" in Ireland and the UK
Event.2: American politician Robert C. Byrd became the longest-serving member of Congress, with a combined service in the House of Representatives and Senate of 56 years 319 days; he died the following year.
Event.3: Black & white leaders in South Africa approve new democratic constitution
Event.4: 1st Solheim Cup Women's Golf, Lake Nona G & CC: US beats Europe 11½-4½ in inaugural event; Kathy Whitworth US captain; Mickey Walker Europe skipper
Event.5:
Jonestown massacre
Jim Jones, leader of the Peoples Temple religious community that he formed in the 1950s, and some 900 of his followers died this day in 1978 in Guyana in a massive act of murder-suicide known as the Jonestown massacre.
Event.6: In Jonestown, Guyana 918 members of the Peoples Temple are murdered or commit suicide under the leadership of cult leader Jim Jones
Event.7:
Alan Moore
British writer
was born
Event.8: "Rock Around The Clock" rock 'n' roll pioneer Bill Haley (27) weds second wife Barbara Cupchak
Event.9: KFC founder Colonel Sanders (58) weds his long-time employee Claudia Price
Event.10: John Christian Watson, the first Labour prime minister of Australia, died in Sydney.
Event.11:
Qaboos bin Said
sultan of Oman
was born
Event.12:
Margaret Atwood
Canadian author
was born
Event.13: Walt Disney's "Steamboat Willie" released, first Mickey Mouse sound cartoon
Event.14: Alan B. Shepard, Jr., the first U.S. astronaut to travel in space, was born in New Hampshire.
Event.15:
Alan B. Shepard, Jr.
American astronaut
was born
Event.16: General Douglas Haig finally calls off 1st Battle of the Somme (WWI) - over 1 million killed or wounded
Event.17:
Johnny Mercer
American composer, vocalist, and businessman
was born
Event.18: Prince Charles (Carl) of Denmark was elected king of Norway as Haakon VII.
Event.19: Philippe-Jean Bunau-Varilla, representing Panama, met with U.S. Secretary of State John Hay to negotiate the Hay–Bunau-Varilla Treaty, which gave the United States a strip 10 miles (16 km) wide across the Isthmus of Panama for construction of the Panama Canal.
Event.20: Famed operatic soprano Amelita Galli-Curci was born in Milan.
Event.21: English playwright and humorist Sir W.S. Gilbert, best known for his collaboration with Sir Arthur Sullivan in comic operas, was born.
Event.22: Brazilian sculptor and architect Aleijadinho, known for his beautiful Rococo statues and his churches, died in Mariana.
Event.23: 2nd Earl Grey Charles Grey (30) weds only daughter of 1st Baron Ponsonby Mary Elizabeth Ponsonby
Event.24: St. Peter's Basilica is consecrated, replacing earlier basilica, world's largest Christian basilica
Event.25: William Caxton, a pioneering English printer, published Dictes and Sayenges of the Phylosophers, the first dated book printed in England.
Event.26: First English dated printed book "Dictes & Sayengis of the Phylosophers" by William Caxton
